Description: Bronze tripodic lamp: deep bowl-body and two round-tipped nozzles (heavy corrosion obscures the details). The edges of the filling-hole are damaged. Leaf-shaped handle-ornament at the rear. Projecting from the centre of the underside, a stem curves towards the rear; its use has not been interpreted. Surface colouration: patchy brown and green corrosion products, incorporating fragments of stone?; some iron staining.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: House of Ashaikhet, Found in a context perhaps of the second half of the second century AD.
Curator's comments: See Favard-Meeks in Brissaud and C.Zivie-Coche 1987-1997 (1998) p.129.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3718)
